data.title: Immunotherapy Regenerative Medicine
data.meta_description: Making your treatments comfortable and stress-free

Training

MEDICAL SURGEON AND MIDWIFE

University of Guadalajara, C.U.CS (University center for health sciences) — 2009-2012

Graduate, Professional ID DGP: 9429443, PEJ 278713

Professional experience

DOCTOR OF THE IMPREP AND NATIONAL PREP PROGRAM IN SETAC — 2021

International program for the implementation in Mexico of HIV Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP); initial assessment and follow-up of qualified users to the program. Medical consultation focused on HIV and other sexually transmitted infections.

EMERGENCY DOCTOR HOSPITEN PUERTO VALLARTA — 2018 – 2021

Assess the patient to subsequently diagnose, treat, evaluate and thus decide the fate of the patient; hospitalization or at home with outpatient treatment.

SAFECARE TOURIST MEDICINE — 2018 – PRESENT

Emergency medical service, emergency and general consultation at home

TOURISM AND OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE — 2017 – 2018 LIVELINESS

Program by San Javier Hospital; Medical service that approaches patients and their places of rest, study or work, putting their provision of primary care, emergencies, medical check-ups and treatments preventive.

Dr. Karla Moraima Castolo Sánchez is a distinguished cardiologist and specialist in cardiac rehabilitation. She completed her training as a Surgeon and Midwife at the University of Guadalajara and specialized in Clinical Cardiology at the National Medical Center West of the Mexican Social Security Institute. Subsequently, she obtained an advanced specialty in Cardiac Rehabilitation and Secondary Prevention at the National Institute of Cardiology “Ignacio Chávez” of the Autonomous University of Mexico.

Dr. Castolo Sánchez has worked as a cardiologist at the Mexican Social Security Institute and at Hospiten. She has co-authored various articles and presentations at major cardiology conferences, including the Mexican Congress of Cardiology and the ESC Congress in Munich. She is also a co-author of a chapter in the book “Mexican Clinics of Cardiology, Cardiovascular Prevention.”

She is an active member of the Mexican Society of Cardiology and the Mexican Society for Heart Care, as well as an international associate of the American College of Cardiology and a professional member of the European Society of Cardiology. She holds certificates in Clinical Cardiology and advanced specialization in Cardiac Rehabilitation, both issued by the Mexican Council of Cardiology.

Title as a medical specialist in traumatology and orthopedics from the Autonomous University of Sinaloa (uas).

Certificate of studies as a specialist in traumatology and orthopedics by the Institute of Security and Social Services of State Workers (ISSSTE).

Certified by the Mexican Council of Orthopedics and Traumatology (cmot), 2017 valid until 2022.

ACADEMIC TRAINING

Specialty in traumatology and orthopedics

Issste Culiacán Regional Hospital “Dr. Manuel Cardenas de la Vega.

Faculty of Medicine, Autonomous University of Sinaloa.

Generation 2013-2017

Surgeons and midwives graduated from:

Faculty of Medicine, Autonomous University of Nuevo León, generation 2005 – 2011.

Undergraduate internship: “José e. González”, Monterrey Nuevo Leon from August 2008 to July 2011.

Social service: secretary of health, health jurisdiction no. 2, assigned to c.s.r. mine, in mine, Nuevo León, from August 2011 to July 2012.

WORK EXPERIENCE

PUNTA DE MITA HOSPITAL, PUNTA MITA, NAYARIT (2018 TO DATE).

POSITION HELD: DOCTOR ATTACHED TO THE TRAUMATOLOGY, ORTHOPEDICS AND SPINE SURGERY SERVICE.

PUERTO VALLARTA REGIONAL HOSPITAL, JALISCO, (2017 – 2020).

POSITION HELD: DOCTOR ATTACHED TO THE TRAUMATOLOGY AND ORTHOPEDICS SERVICE, EVENING SHIFT.

REGIONAL HOSPITAL ISSSTE CULIACÁN, SINALOA.

POSITION HELD: RESIDENT PHYSICIAN

FUNCTIONS PERFORMED: MEDICAL-SURGICAL CARE IN THE SPECIALTY OF TRAUMATOLOGY AND ORTHOPEDICS.

EMME MEDICAL EMERGENCIES

PHARMACIES SAN ANTONIO, MTY NUEVO LEON

POSITION HELD: GENERAL PHYSICIAN. CONSULTATION MANAGER

ARTICLES AND SERVICES OF HEALTH AND INDUSTRIAL SAFETY ASSSI

PERFORMED FUNCTIONS: APPLICATION OF MEDICAL EXAMINATIONS BOTH PERIODIC AND ENTRY TO PERSONNEL EMPLOYED IN DIFFERENT COMPANIES. GENERAL CONSULTATION FOR EMPLOYEES WITHIN THE COMPANY.

VASCULAR LASER CLINIC: AS ASSISTANT PHYSICIAN IN PROCEDURES RELATED TO THE ELIMINATION OF VARICOSE VEINS (SAPHENECTOMY LASER, MINIPHLEBOTOMY, ETC.)

H. FIRE DEPARTMENT, SALTILLO COAHUILA AUGUST 2004 – JULY 2005

POSITION PERFORMED: FIREFIGHTER – PARAMEDIC

Dr. Vicente Boscá Terol is an accomplished physician with a foundational degree in Medicine and Surgery from the Faculty of Medicine of Valencia, complemented by specialized training in Homeopathy from C.E.D.H. With a career spanning over 30 years, he has dedicated himself to both practice and education, notably in Homeopathy, where he has served as a professor for three decades. His expertise extends to Cosmetic Surgery with a Master’s from the College of Physicians of Barcelona, and he is skilled in Neural Therapy, Ozonotherapy, and Regenerative Medicine. Dr. Boscá Terol has maintained a continuous private practice in Xátiva and Valencia, contributing significantly to the medical community as a co-founder of the International OTTO H. WARBURG Conferences for Spain and South America. His commitment to medical education and patient care is evident through his roles as a trainer and educator in the field of regenerative and aesthetic medicine.

Doctorate in Chemical-Biological Sciences National School of Biological Sciences, date of degree obtained: July 3, 2009

Projects approved by SEPI of IPN as a participant

2013 Regenerative medicine in bone: polyphenolic derivatives as adjuvants in the treatment of osteoregenerative diseases by inducing differentiation of human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells into osteoblasts.

2014 Regenerative medicine in the heart: the application of mesenchymal stem cells in an animal model with acute myocardial infarction modifies the expression of metalloproteinases and tissue structure, reducing the damage caused by ischemia.

2014 In vitro evaluation of the activation of human NKT lymphocytes in infection by Brucella abortus

2014 Reprogramming of cellular progenitors in acute T lymphoblastic leukemia induced by SCL and LMO1 oncogenes in transgenic mice.

2015 Effect of dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA) on the expression of the genes BMP2, SPARK, and RUNX2 as osteogenic differentiation markers in bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells

As project director

2017 In vitro effect of the methanolic extract of Gymnosperma glutinosum on three tumor cell lines.

2018 Effect of titanium dioxide nanoparticles on proliferation, membrane markers, and phagocytosis in human endometrial mesenchymal stem cells

Published articles

1.- Successful creation of a Neoesophagus through Tissue Engineering in an Animal Model (2008) Mexican Journal of Pediatric Surgery. Vol. 15, No. 2, April-June

2.- Autologous mesenchymal stem cells and autologous skin graft for treatment of a chronic ulcer secondary to type 2 diabetes mellitus (2015) Surgery and Surgeons. Vol.83. No. 6

3.- Inhibition of the Na+/H+ antiporter induces cell death in TF-1 erythroleukemia cells stimulated by the stem cell factor (2015) Journal of Cytokine 75, 142–150.

4.- Internalization of titanium dioxide nanoparticles by glial cells is given at short times and is mainly mediated by actin reorganization- dependent endocytosis (2015). Neurotoxicology 51: 27– 37.

5.- Effect of dehydroepiandrosterone on expression of BMP2, SPARC, and RUNX2 in human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (2016). Mexican Journal of Chemical Engineering, vol.15. No. 1.

6.- Comparison between mesenchymal stem cells obtained from bone marrow, adipose tissue, and Wharton’s jelly based on the criteria of the ISCT. Mexican Journal of Biomedical Engineering. Vol. 38 | No. 1 | January-April 2017 | pp280-287

7.- Effect of conditioned medium from H9C2 cell line treated with dehydroepiandrosterone and exposed to damage on the motility of bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells Mexican Journal of Biomedical Engineering, Vol. 38 | No. 1 | January-April 2017 | pp 256-263.

8.- Effect of Dehydroepiandrosterone and Tria-mcinolone Acetonide on the 3T3-L1 cell line Mexican Journal of Biomedical Engineering. Vol. 38 | No. 1 | January-April 2017 |pp 288-296.

9.- How infectious agents are involved in childhood leukemia (2017). Archives of Medical Research, 48:305-315

He began his academic career in Biology at the Faculty of Higher Studies “Zaragoza”, UNAM, where he completed his undergraduate studies, presenting a thesis on the effect of sodium caseinate on the proliferation and differentiation of myeloid cell lines. He continued with a Master of Science at the Postgraduate College, researching the antileukemic potential of Sechium spp. genotypes, and later expanded his specialization with a Master in Nutrition and Food-Drug Interactions at the University of Barcelona, focusing his work on the relationship between nutrition and medicine. His doctoral training began with a Doctorate in Sciences at the Postgraduate College, where he was recognized for his research on the antitumor effect of Sechium P. Browne, followed by a Doctorate in Education at UTEL University, demonstrating an exceptional commitment to scientific research and education.

He began his academic career in Biology at the National School of Professional Studies “Zaragoza”, UNAM, presenting a thesis on the effect of lymphocytes and monocytes on cell proliferation. He furthered his education with a Master’s in Science (Biology) at the Faculty of Sciences, UNAM, expanding his specialization in the field. His education progressed with a Doctorate in Science (Biology) at the same institution, focusing on the study of free radicals in the cellular defense system and DNA damage. His doctoral research explored the induction of Fc receptor expression by Interleukin 1 in normal and leukemic myeloid cells, establishing his profile as a distinguished scientist in biology.

Specialist in human genetics and biology, focusing on hemophilia and mesenchymal stem cells. A graduate of the University of Guadalajara, she has participated in various national and international conferences presenting research on molecular diagnosis and genetic polymorphisms.

Lidia has extensive experience in genetics and stem cell laboratories, holding key roles that include advising on research protocols, processing and storing stem cells, and managing regulatory procedures. She has worked at prestigious institutions such as the Institute of Cellular Therapy, Provida Fertility Clinic, and the Institute of Molecular Biology Research of Western Mexico, among others.

As the author of numerous scientific publications, she has significantly contributed to the understanding of hemophilia and genetics in Mexico. Additionally, she possesses advanced skills in molecular biomedicine, cryobiology, and laboratory techniques such as PCR and flow cytometry. Her professional profile reflects a solid combination of academic research and practical application in the field of genetics and stem cells.

Graduated from the Faculty of Higher Studies Zaragoza, UNAM, with a Bachelor’s degree in Sciences and recognition for academic excellence in inter-school competitions.

Specialized in biology and in vitro culture management, with practical experience in sugarcane plant production and a proven track record of technical skills in hematopoiesis and leukemia, including the handling of various cell lines and laboratory animals.

Co-author of an international scientific publication contributing to the understanding of leukemia treatment, highlighting a commitment to applied research and the advancement of knowledge in the oncology field.
